description: Industry Engagement Day - Flood Hazard Identification and Mapping Program (FHIMP)While Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) is finalizing the first phase of the Flood Hazard Identification and Mapping Program (FHIMP), NRCan is expanding FHIMP activities under the National Adaptation Strategy. The FHIMP is a cost-shared program with provinces and territories to complete flood maps for higher-risk areas and disseminate this flood hazard information to the public.   **Tender Description - Description de l'arrêté public d'appel d'offres**: NRCan is implementing a Flood Hazard Identification and Mapping Program (FHIMP). This cost-shared initiative is undertaken in partnership with the provinces and territories to address high-risk areas of flooding. Through proactive planning and forecasting, NRCan aims to provide essential flood hazard information to public stakeholders. Recently, NRCan completed the first phase of FHIMP and is now enhancing current program requirements and details to support its objectives.
